day1.name: Nukkad Natak
rules: Time limit - Maximum 15 minutes from entry to exit.
We can provide basic props if informed in advance.
Instruments are allowed.
There’s no upper bound on team sizes.
Script submissions due by 1st Feb 2025. Please mail them to parvaaz@iiitb.ac.in.
The play should preferably be in Hindi or English.
The organizers have the power to disqualify any team based on any grounds they seem fit.
day1.about: Explore the vibrant world of street theater with 'NUKKAD NAATAK' This event invites you to harness the power of compelling performances to raise your voice and drive societal change.

day1.name: Sargam
rules: Time Limit:Solo singers are allotted a maximum of 4 minutes for their entire stage performance.

Musical Diversity:Participants are required to showcase their versatility by presenting at least one of Indian classical/semi-classical and non-classical genre. Separate prizes will be awarded for each category.
Restrictions on Beatboxing and Rapping:Beatboxing and rapping are not allowed as part of the solo singing performance.

Backing Track or Accompanist Options: Participants may choose to use a pre-submitted backing track, have one accompanist, or play a musical instrument themselves. However, it is emphasized that the judging will solely be based on the singer's vocals, not the backing track.
Basic Effects Allowance: Singers are permitted to request basic effects such as compression, reverb, etc., to enhance their performance.

Judging Criteria: Performances will be evaluated based on several factors, including pitch accuracy, rhythm,musicality, skill level, stage presence, and other relevant aspects. The judging panel will consider these elements to determine the overall quality of the solo singing performance.
day1.about: Step into the spotlight at Infin8 ’25’s Solo Singing Competition! This is your chance to mesmerize the audience with your voice and compete for glory. Fill out the registration form below to secure your place in this thrilling vocal showcase. Let your voice soar and steal the show!

day1.name: Stock-A-thon
rules: Time Limit:Solo singers are allotted a maximum of 4 minutes for their entire stage performance.

Musical Diversity:Participants are required to showcase their versatility by presenting at least one of Indian classical/semi-classical and non-classical genre. Separate prizes will be awarded for each category.
Restrictions on Beatboxing and Rapping:Beatboxing and rapping are not allowed as part of the solo singing performance.

Backing Track or Accompanist Options: Participants may choose to use a pre-submitted backing track, have one accompanist, or play a musical instrument themselves. However, it is emphasized that the judging will solely be based on the singer's vocals, not the backing track.
Basic Effects Allowance: Singers are permitted to request basic effects such as compression, reverb, etc., to enhance their performance.

Judging Criteria: Performances will be evaluated based on several factors, including pitch accuracy, rhythm,musicality, skill level, stage presence, and other relevant aspects. The judging panel will consider these elements to determine the overall quality of the solo singing performance.
day1.about: Stock-A-thon is an online event in which participants have to build their portfolio in a virtual environment, simulating the real-world stock market, using virtual money for trading hypothetical stocks, bonds, or other securities over a set period of time.

day1.name: CODM
rules: Format: Single-Elimination Bracket
Teams: 15-20 registered teams
Objective: Compete to emerge as the ultimate champion through skill, strategy, and teamwork.
2.Tournament Structure
Initial Rounds: If more than 16 teams register, an initial qualifying round will be conducted to reduce the number of teams to 16.
Round 1 (16 teams): BO1 (Best of 1)
Quarterfinals (8 teams): BO1
Semifinals (4 teams): BO3 (Best of 3)
Finals (2 teams): BO3 (Best of 3)
3. Game Modes
Round 1 & Quarterfinals: Game modes will be randomly selected from the following: Frontline,Team Deathmatch (TDM),Domination,Hardpoint,Control
Semifinals: Game modes will be randomly selected from the following:,Hardcore Team Deathmatch (Hardcore TDM),Hardcore Domination,Hardcore Hardpoint,Search & Destroy (S&D)
Finals: Same as Semifinals: Random selection between Hardcore TDM, Hardcore Domination, Hardcore Hardpoint, and Search & Destroy (S&D).
4. Match Rules
1.Match Settings: Standard tournament rules for each game mode. Time limits, score limits, and other settings will adhere to competitive CODM standards.
2. Victory Conditions: BO1: The team that wins the single match advances. BO3: The team that wins 2 out of 3 matches advances.
3.Tiebreakers: In case of a tie (e.g., equal scores in Control or Domination), total kills across the match will decide the winner.
5. Code of Conduct
Fair Play: Cheating, hacking, or use of any third-party tools is strictly prohibited.
2. Sportsmanship: Players must respect opponents, teammates, and officials.
3. Penalties: Violations of rules may result in match forfeiture, disqualification, or bans.
6. Additional Details
1. Team Requirements: Each team must consist of exactly 5 players. Substitutes are not allowed.
2. Communication: All teams must join the designated WhatsApp group for match updates and coordination.
3. Equipment: Players are responsible for ensuring their devices and internet connections are stable.
day1.about: Immerse yourself in the exhilarating IIITBs CODM World Championship, where teams engage in intense team deathmatches. Showcase your gaming prowess, secure kills for bonuses, and strive for victory in this thrilling championship. Get ready for the adrenaline-fueled action of strategic combat and teamwork!

day1.name: Cut to the Chase
rules: Individual participation
Time limit: 15 minutes
Creative presentations are encouraged
day1.about: A picture speaks a thousand words, a film is a million pictures… do the math! Show off your writing, acting and editing prowess to influence the masses with your short yet impactful film.

day1.name: Saaz, Sur and Taal
rules: Time Limit:
Solo instrumentalists are allotted a maximum of 4 minutes for their entire stage performance.
Musical Diversity:
Participants are required to showcase their versatility by playing at least one percussion or non-percussive instrument. Separate prizes will be awarded for each category.
Backing Track or Accompanist Options:

Participants may choose to use a pre-submitted backing track or have one accompanist.However, it is emphasized that the judging will solely be based on the instrumentalist's performance, not the backing track.
Basic Effects Allowance:
Instrumentalists are permitted to request basic effects such as compression, reverb, etc., to enhance their performance. Note that looping is allowed, but will not affect the judgement.
Judging Criteria:

Performances will be evaluated based on several factors, including pitch accuracy, rhythm,musicality, skill level, stage presence, and other relevant aspects. The judging panel will consider these elements to determine the overall quality of the solo singing performance.
day1.about: Showcase your mastery and passion for music at Infin8 ’25’s Solo Instrumental Competition! Whether you play strings, keys, or anything in between, this is your moment to shine. Complete the form below to register and claim your spot in this incredible musical journey. Let your instrument tell your story!

day1.name: Battle of Bands
rules: Time Limit:
Bands are allocated a maximum of 20 minutes for their performance, inclusive of stage setup.
Member Limit:
Each participating band can consist of up to 8 members.
Instrumentalists Requirement:
Bands must include a minimum of 2 instrumentalists among their members.
On-Stage Presence:
At any given moment during the performance, there should be a minimum of 3 band members actively performing on stage.
Genre Freedom:
There are no restrictions on the genre of the musical performance; bands are free to explore and showcase their preferred style.
Pre-recorded Backing Tracks:
The use of pre-recorded backing tracks during the performance is strictly prohibited.
Original Composition Bonus:
Extra points will be awarded to bands that present an impressive original composition during their performance.
Judging Criteria:

Bands will be evaluated based on various criteria, including but not limited to – the tightness of their performance, individual skills of each member, musicality, and overall stage presence.Judges will consider these elements to determine the winners of the competition, and their decision will be final.
day1.about: Welcome to the Battle of the Bands registration for Infin8 ’25! This is your chance to showcase your musical talent, compete with the best, and captivate the crowd. Complete the form below to secure your spot in this electrifying competition. Get ready to rock the stage and make history!

day1.name: Trapped in Tangents
rules: Team Format:
Gather your crew of 3 players per team and gear up to compete against the best. Teamwork, strategy, and quick reflexes are the keys to victory!
If time permits , it will be a round robin format , else it will be a knockout format
Reward:
1st Prize ₹2500
2nd Prize ₹1500
day1.about: Prepare for a rollercoaster of mathematical excitement with Trapped in Tangents! This is not your average quiz; it's a high-energy, fun-filled competition designed to engage participants in multiple thrilling rounds of math trivia. Whether you're a seasoned math whiz or just enjoy the thrill of numbers, this contest promises a riveting experience for all.

day1.name: Viral Vision Reel making competition
rules: Individual participation
Time limit: 5 minutes
Original content only
day1.about:
Are you ready to showcase your creativity and storytelling skills? Join our Reel-Making Writing Competition and bring your ideas to life! This competition is your chance to shine. Below are the competition details, guidelines, and the theme for this year.
Note- it's an offline event you must be present to participate

day1.name: PXL8 Photography Competition
rules: Individual participation
Time limit: 5 minutes
Original content only
day1.about:
Join us for a unique photography event! Explore symmetry through geometry and object framing, showcasing the world with an artist's eye. Capture and share your creative perspective in a celebration of balanced compositions. Elevate your skills and connect with fellow photographers in this memorable experience. Don't miss out! Theme: Symmetry.
Note- it's an offline event you must be present to participate

day2.name: Ancient Echoes
rules: This is a solo/duo quiz which consists of questions from Yoga and Indian culture.
Participants must join the WhatsApp group to be eligible to participate and stay updated on the details of the event.
To ensure a smooth start, participants must arrive at the venue 10 minutes ahead of the scheduled time.
Round 1: MCQ Quiz on online platform
Several MCQ questions will be displayed and the score depends on both speed and accuracy.
Top 30 participants will advance to round 2
Round 2: Pen-Paper questionnaire
The second round involves solving a pen-paper questionnaire that may include crosswords, fill in the blanks, passage comprehension, and word searches.
Scoring criteria remains the same as round 1.
Top 3 performers will win the event.
Rewards:
1st place - ₹3500
2nd place - ₹2500
3rd place - ₹1000
Usage of any electronic gadgets for seeking answers or asking for external help will lead to direct disqualification.
The decision of SPOC is final in case of any disputes.
The rules are subject to change at the discretion of the organizers.
day2.about: Get ready to channel your inner cultural wizard! 'Ancient Echos' is a fun and challenging quiz that tests your knowledge of Indian culture, yoga, and spirituality. Compete with friends and see how well you know our ancient Indian culture.

day2.name: Mono Acting
rules: 1. Solo Act: Each participant must perform a solo act, which can either be a monologue or a solo scene adapted from a script. No group performances are allowed.
2. Time Limit: Each performance must be completed within a strict time limit of 5 minutes. Participants exceeding the time limit may face penalties or disqualification.
3. Language: Performances can be delivered in Hindi, English, or a combination of both languages (bilingual acts).

4. Script Selection: Participants have the liberty to choose their own scripts.However, if the script is adapted from an existing work, appropriate credit must be given to the original author or source.
5. Props: Basic props such as a table or a chair can be provided by the organizers. These requirements must be communicated to the organizingteam well in advance.

6. Disqualification Clause: The organizing committee reserves the right to disqualify any participant on grounds they deem appropriate. Participants are expected to adhere to the guidelines and maintain decorum.
7. Technical Requirements: If the act involves the use of instruments that need to be connected to speakers or other technical equipment, participants must inform the organizers beforehand.
All your requirements should be emailed to parvaaz@iiitb.ac.in
day2.about: Step into the spotlight and show the world what you're capable of! Monoacting is all about bringing stories to life through your voice, body, and imagination. Whether you're a seasoned performer or a budding actor, this is your chance to shine solo and captivate the audience with your talent. Register now and become the star of your own story!

day2.name: Clash Royale
rules: All participants must be present at the venue at the specified time.Failure to attend without prior notice will result in disqualification.
The first round will follow a tournament-style format. Subsequent rounds will transition to knockouts, depending on the number of participants.
All matches will be conducted in a standard 1v1 format. Different game modes will be used, which will be announced on the day of the tournament.
To ensure fair play all the cards which are above level 11 are capped to level 11 (Tournament Standard)
No cheating, account sharing, or use of any unauthorized third-party software. Players caught violating fair play rules will be immediately disqualified.
Players are responsible for ensuring a stable internet connection. If a player disconnects during a match, the game will continue, and the result will stand.
Players are responsible for the maintenance of their devices. If a device fails during a match, it will not be restarted.
In the event of a tie, the following criteria will determine the rankings (in order of priority):
1. Number of wins
2. Number of crowns earned
3. Least Number of loses
For any issues, participants should contact the designated Single Point of Contact (SPOC). The SPOC’s decision will be final and binding.
day2.about: Dive into the thrilling world of Clash Royale in our E-Sports event! Experience the strategic rush of this vintage Supercell classic tower rush and strategy game. Showcase your gaming prowess, join the online competition, and compete for the top spot. It's your chance to enjoy the excitement of Clash Royale, prove your skills, and have a blast in this action-packed gaming showdown!

day2.name: Ramp It Up
rules: You can form a team of 2 or take part individually.
The time limit for every team/individual would be 1 minute (including setup and performance both).
Negative marking if participants exceed the time limit.
Vulgarity is strongly prohibited. Any form of obscenity will lead to debarring the team/individual from the contest.
Teams/individuals will be judged on costumes, walking stance, attitude, hairstyle, and overall presentation.
The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
All costumes are permitted, which maintain decency, including original costumes and fashion designs.
Purchased, professionally made, or rented costumes are permitted.
Results Announcement: On our Instagram handle https://www.instagram.com/infin8_iiitb/
day2.about: Get ready to own the spotlight at our college's fashion show in the Infin8! 'Ramp It Up ' is your chance to showcase your unique style and make a statement on the runway. Whether you're a trendsetter or just love fashion, this is your moment to shine. Join us for an evening of glamour, creativity, and runway magic – where style meets the spotlight!

day2.name: JAM
rules: Individual participation
Time limit: 5 minutes
Original content only
day2.about: JAM, originating from the renowned BBC radio show, is a captivating verbal challenge game where participants strive to speak for exactly one minute on a given topic without breaking three fundamental rules. The game has evolved into a delightful and light-hearted event, emphasizing wit, spontaneity, and linguistic agility. Reference -Please watch the first few rounds in the video below for reference. It’s a very fun and light-hearted event so we might have bonus points for entertaining speeches and challenges ;) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Zu-2eNYmMM

day2.name: Rangmanch
rules: Time limit - The play duration should be around a minimum of 20 minutes and around a maximum of 45 minutes from ‘stage entry’ to ‘stage exit’.
There can be maximum of 15 members on a team. Out of these, maximum 2 people can be present on the light and sound console.
We can provide basic props if informed in advance such as tables or chairs.
Script submissions are due by 1st Feb 2024, along with a 10-minute recording of the play for the screening round. Please mail them to parvaaz@iiitb.ac.in. Also,specify the total duration of the play.
The organizers have the power to disqualify any team based on any grounds they seem fit.
If your play contains instruments to be connected to speaks, it should be well specified in the mail containing the script and recording.
day2.about: Unleash your unique talents on the theatrical battlefield. Join the Rang Manch and let the curtains rise on your unique talents as you vie for the spotlight in this thrilling showcase of theatrical brilliance!

day2.name: BGMI
rules: Requirements:
1. Participants are required to bring their own gaming devices and headsets.
2. All participants must adhere to the tournament schedule and arrive on time for check-in.
3. Players must ensure their gaming equipment is fully charged and properly working.
4. Participants must agree to abide by the tournament rules and regulations, including fair play and sportsmanship guidelines.
Rules and Guidelines General Guidelines:
1. By participating, participants agree to abide by the rules.
2. Event details are subject to change without prior notice.
3. Organizers have the final authority on all matters, including the discretion to disqualify any participant or team without justification.
Specific Rules:
1. Cheating, hacking, or use of exploits will not be tolerated.
2. Respectful behaviour towards other players and organizers is mandatory.
3. Any disputes will be resolved by the event head, whose decisions are final.
day2.about: Embark on a thrilling adventure with IIITBs BGMI Showdown, a battleground where teams collide in intense battles. Demonstrate your gaming prowess, securing kills for bonuses as you strive for triumph in this gripping showdown. Brace yourself for an adrenaline-fueled experience of strategic combat and seamless teamwork, as every move counts in this electrifying gaming spectacle!

day2.name: Slam Poetry
rules: The game mode is Duels
Players must bring their own laptops
0.5x multiplier from round 5 onwards.
Maps are random and will be ADW or ACW
All players should be present in the room and can’t play remotely
SPOCs withhold the right to disqualify any participant at their discretion
Geogusser rules apply (no googling)
For 2v2 the teammates can talk to each other
Spectating friends cannot help
No outside help allowed
day2.about: Amidst the chaos of life, immerse yourself in the cathartic world of Slam Poetry. This competition beckons individuals to take a breather, step onto the stage, and unleash the power of spoken word to express their innermost thoughts, emotions, and reflections.

day2.name: Smash Karts
rules: Team Format:
Gather your crew of 3 players per team and gear up to compete against the best. Teamwork, strategy, and quick reflexes are the keys to victory!
If time permits , it will be a round robin format , else it will be a knockout format
Reward:
1st Prize ₹2500
2nd Prize ₹1500
day2.about: Smashkarts – The Ultimate Gaming Showdown! Get ready for an action-packed gaming experience like never before! 🚀 Thrilling gameplay, intense battles, and an electrifying atmosphere. Smash your way to the top and prove your dominance! It’s not just about the prizes—it’s about the glory, the bragging rights, and the ultimate test of your skills.Don’t miss your chance to be a part of this epic gaming competition. Rally your squad, bring your A-game, and let the smashing begin! 🏆

day2.name: Geoguessr
rules: The game mode is Duels
Players must bring their own laptops
0.5x multiplier from round 5 onwards.
Maps are random and will be ADW or ACW
All players should be present in the room and can’t play remotely
SPOCs withhold the right to disqualify any participant at their discretion
Geogusser rules apply (no googling)
For 2v2 the teammates can talk to each other
Spectating friends cannot help
No outside help allowed
day2.about: Join us for an exciting GeoGuessr event where participants will be dropped into random locations around the world and challenged to guess their surroundings! Test your geography skills, explore new places, and compete with others in a fun and engaging way. Whether you're a seasoned explorer or a casual player, this event is sure to be an adventure!

day3.name: Brush Up
rules: Basic materials like a drawing sheet, brushes, pencils,eraser, paint palette, etc will be provided.But it is recommended that students bring their own medium for painting as only limited number of acrylic/poster paints and brushes will be provided.
Participants may choose either painting, sketching, or both, based on their interest and expertise.
The same amount of time will be allocated to all, even if both categories are chosen for participation.
The artwork must be created at the venue and not beforehand.
Few on-spot registrations are available for IIITB students.
Non-students must register beforehand to ensure participation.
day3.about: This is the painting and sketching competition. Inviting artists of all ages and skill levels to showcase their talent and express their imagination. Any style of art is welcomed, we just want you all to have fun!

day3.name: Valorant
rules: Each team must consist of 5 players and can optionally have 1 substitute.
All team leaders must join the designated WhatsApp group before the matches.All official announcements, schedules, and updates will be communicated through WhatsApp.
Ensure you have the latest version of the game installed before the match day.No delays will be entertained on the match day due to version issues.
All matches, except for Finals and Semi-Finals (depending on the total number of teams), willfollow a knockout format.
Preliminary Rounds, Quarterfinals, and Semifinals: Best-of-3.
Finals: Best-of-5.
Matches will feature a map veto system.Teams will alternate in banning and picking maps as per the standard map veto procedure.
All weapons, agents, and abilities are allowed unless currently disabled in Ranked Mode.
Any form of cheating, abuse, or exploitation of bugs/glitches will result in immediatedisqualification of the team.Referees or tournament administrators will monitor the matches for compliance.

Teams are expected to join the match lobby at least 15 minutes prior to the scheduled start time.A maximum grace period of 5 minutes will be allowed for a late team; failure to join within thistime will result in a forfeit.
Finals will be conducted offline at the IIITB campus. If there is a special case, please contact theorganizers.
Substitutes can only be used before the match begins.Mid-match substitutions are not allowed.
Any disputes or issues during the tournament must be reported to the organizers immediately.The decision of the organizers will be final and binding.

Players are expected to maintain a professional and respectful demeanor towards opponents,teammates, and organizers.Toxic behavior, harassment, or offensive language will lead to penalties or disqualification.
Matches may be streamed or spectated by authorized personnel.Players are not allowed to stream their matches without prior approval from the organizers.

In case of severe technical issues (e.g., server crash), the match may be paused or restarted atthe organizers' discretion.Players are responsible for ensuring their own hardware and network readiness.
Depending on the average rank of the team, you may get a bye in the first round.
day3.about: Embark on a thrilling adventure with IIITBs Valorant Showdown, a battleground where teams collide in intense battles. Demonstrate your gaming prowess, securing kills for bonuses as you strive for triumph in this gripping showdown. Brace yourself for an adrenaline-fueled experience of strategic combat and seamless teamwork, as every move counts in this electrifying gaming spectacle!

day3.name: FIFA
rules: 1. General Rules
Teams Selection:
No fictional or All-Star teams are allowed.
Players may select any regular-season teams included in the original game.
Both players can select the same team (e.g., Barcelona). In such cases:
The 'away' player must pick the Away Jersey for that team.
'Away' players are responsible for ensuring their jersey does not resemble the home team's jersey.
Any disputes regarding jersey selection will be resolved by a coin toss.
Match Type: Classic Kick-Off
FIFA Trainer: Off
Difficulty Level: Legendary
Game Speed: Normal
Half Length:4 minutes (Until Quarter-Finals) 6 minutes (Semi-Finals and Finals)
Semi-Finals will be played over two legs with away goals rule applied.
Finals and Third-Place matches will be single-leg matches.
Match Outcomes: In case of a tie, the match will proceed to Extra Time (Classic) and then Penalties if required.
2. Gameplay Rules
Controller Policy: Players may bring their own controllers. If a controller is defective, the player can pause the game with the opponent’s approval and notify the referee.
Pausing: Players must request their opponent's permission before pausing the game.Pausing is only allowed with the opponent's approval.
Formations and Tactics: All formations and tactics must be decided before the start of the match.Players will be given 2 minutes to finalize their setup.
3. Tournament Format
Knock-Out Rounds: Each round will be a single-elimination round.
Third-Place Match: A one-leg match will determine the third-place winner.
Disqualification: Players who fail to show up at their allotted time without justification will be disqualified.
4. Disputes and Referee Decisions: Any disputes during the game will be resolved by the referee.The referee’s decision is final.
5. Miscellaneous Rules: Rule Changes: The rules are subject to change at the discretion of the organizers.
day3.about: Welcome to FIFA – a thrilling 11v11 football spectacle where the beauty of the game meets strategic brilliance! In this premier football simulation, it's not just about goals; it's about crafting a winning strategy with your unique squad. Choose players with specialized skills, coordinate plays, and outsmart your opponents. In FIFA, tactics take center stage, elevating your gameplay beyond simple ball control. Experience the essence of football where every move counts, and victory belongs to the tactically astute!

day3.name: Nritta
rules: Performance Duration: Each performance should last between 3 to 5 minutes.
Participants: Only college students are allowed to participate.
Dance Styles: All dance styles, including fusion, are welcome.
Props Usage: Props that litter the stage, such as colors or confetti are strictly prohibited. If you plan to use props, prior approval is required.
Soundtrack Submission: Participants must have their tracks (in mp3 format) ready by 5th February 2025. Mode of submission will be informed at that time.
Conduct: Performances must maintain decorum, with no vulgarity allowed.
day3.about: Anticipate an electrifying spectacle of dance at the grand event, 'Nritta.'' Elevate your performance as a solo artist or collaborate in a duo, and let the stage be your canvas for up to 5 minutes of captivating expression.  Make every moment count and immerse yourself in the rhythmic world of 'Nritta.' The spotlight awaits, so get ready to leave an indelible mark on the stage with your dance prowess.

day3.name: League of Fanatics
rules: Round 1: Choose Your Track
1.Anime & Sports (Who believe Naruto run is peak athletic form)
2.Movies & Games (who've finished more fictional storylines than conversations)
3.Music & Books (who sing theme songs in the shower)
Top 4 teams from each category advance! Your parents still won't be impressed, but we will be.
Round 2: The Mashup
12 teams split into 2 groups. Time to prove you didn't waste all those hours watching 'just one more episode.' Top 3 from each group advances.
Final Round: The Ultimate Showdown 6 teams battle it out to determine who has the most useless knowledge.
Reward:
1st Prize ₹5000
2nd Prize ₹4000
3rd Prize ₹3000
day3.about: For everyone whose brain is stuffed with facts that will never help them file taxes (but might win them this competition).

day3.name: Infinitude
rules: Team Size: A team should comprise of at least 5 members and at most 20 members.
Performance: Each team will be given 7 minutes as performance time and 2 minutes of setup time. Vulgarity is not allowed within performances.
Participants: All performers must be college students and proof in the form of an official college ID card must be with each participant.
Style: All dance styles, including any kind of fusion, is permitted.

Props: If a team employs any kind of props, prior approval would be required. Props that may potentially litter the stage, such as colors, flowers etc, are strictly prohibited. In case of requirements such as digital backdrop, any specific lighting setup, they need to be provided beforehand.
Music: Soundtrack to be provided in .mp3 format, latest by 5th February, through the prescribed mode of submission, that will be intimated later.
day3.about: Step into the cultural tapestry of Infinitude, a group dance competition that adds a dynamic flair to our festivities! Embrace the opportunity with a nominal registration fee and the allure of enticing prizes for the top performers. Let the rhythm of your collective expression become a highlight of our cultural celebration!
